Get back here you little bug. I'll squash you flat!
You think you can run from me?
I will carve a swath through a thousand of your sycophants!
You can't hide. I'll sniff you out.
The bully flees when the bullied can fight back.
He's in here somewhere...
He's getting desperate.
Keep running. You'll die tired.
I'm going to find you, and when I do...

Is this what I've been doing...?
That one does look appetizing...
Like a mirror...
He doesn't care about fighting!
I am nothing like him!
You bloated pig, you know nothing of hunger.
I see you comparing us.
We are nothing alike!
She falters!
Winded already?
Royalty has made you soft.
I'll not incubate your hellspawn!
Funny, never pegged you as the motherly type.
Your children will be just as putrid as you, I'm sure.
The pus-filled sac doesn't fall far from the bloody, leaking tree.
Don't mock us with this coquettish game.
I didn't fall for it then, I won't fall for it now.
Oh, did I strike a nerve?
There's that familiar anger.
You were always so easy to provoke.
It was a game then. It's real now. I'll win this time too.
Stick it out any longer and I'll wear it like a necklace.
When this is over, your head will decorate my throne.
By God you've gotten fat.
I haven't decided whether to eat you or let you rot as an example.
One could always improve on perfection.
Noble of you to try, but I'm already flawless.
Diamonds are not made unbreakable by soft rock.
Yes, yes. Just get with the prodding already.
Remove my helmet and I'll remove your face.
You can't cure this one. But you may try on the less virulent ones.
Seems like a waste. A little bloodletting will cure anything.
That fine one, with the hat. Does she have any snuff left?
You are far less gentle than the one with the bird mask.
Mm, cozy, but needs work.
Strange times make for strange bedfellows.
What a du-... delightful place.
It's not home, but it'll do for now.
You face a daunting task. You will need allies. You will need me.
I have need of an army, you have need of soldiers. Let's make a deal.
The Court and its monsters will not wait.
If you are to be freed of the Curse, there must be action.
We stand on the brink. Do not tarry.
It is serene out here. Soothing, almost. Strange.
Mm, feeling peckish today.
I suppose taking you out for dinner would be too literal.
So many potential meals about today...
I would delve... I would... EAT.
The horror below is nothing compared to the emptiness within.
Eenie meenie minie moe, catch a peasant by the toe...
Ahahaha! Don't run, you'll only die tired!
I always knew it would come to this. What monster would trust a man?
I expected this. I trusted you not to go through with it.
My just reward for trusting a human's word.
I've experienced death once before. I remain unimpressed.
Don't expect my death to free you from your bond.
At last, a chance to meet my maker.
I might fall. But that will not be the end.
It would be a noble end, but for...
And now you know the shape of what is below.
The first level isn't so bad. The rest...
There is hunger down there, too. I can feel it...
There is kinship under the earth. And above it too, now...
Somehow... I don't feel all that monstrous anymore.
... I seemed to have lost my appetite. Hm...
What lurks below is a threat to us all. The Court can wait.
This would be ironic if it weren't so embarrassing!
Free me, immediately!
I'm the one doing the eating around here!
I've decided the fishmen make better allies.
An alluring song... could be... useful...?
All's fair in love and war. And this... is a little of both.
Sorry dear, but there are more of them than there are of you.
I guess you earned my loyalty after all.
Oh, the misery! My mind was clouded by, er, seashells?
I suppose quality has a quantity all its own.
We broke up. Messy affair, don't want to talk about it.
The weight of my misdeeds...!
No! I am not one of you!
I am above this!
I can not -- will not -- be stopped!

Tainted Vintage
What Was Lost
Abattoir, or Boudoir?
... While the monster seems content to gorge itself on the contents of the butcher's storehouse, it is recommended that residents steer clear until the beast has eaten her fill.
Strange Bedfellows

A monster exiled from her pack, seeking an army to usurp a hostile queen. Have we fallen on such desperate times that we'd consider throwing our lot in with the very creatures we've sought out to destroy?
Your sword arm is strong, and you've got good sense.
Should you die, I would briefly mourn you before eating your corpse. High praise, you know!
Your grace matches my own, in some ways.
As a girl, such bruises and bumps were common fare from my instructors.
Please, you're not nearly as appetizing as you think.
Your discomfort is noted, dear. Now bite on this while we set that bone.
Relax. I'm here.
Now, if I were to die, that'd be cause for concern.
I wouldn't think too hard about how it works. I'm just hungry a lot.
Take of me what you need.
Never say I've not sacrificed for this cause.
Don't worry. I'll take my payment soon enough.
A lady needs her beauty rest.
Goosedown pillow and fine sheets fit for royalty.
Of course I made room for it. What do I need with torches?
I'm on a diet.
No thank you dear, I'm on a cleanse.
I'm keeping an eye on my figure.
A proper lady knows enough to keep them wanting.
Hunger and thirst are similar enough. It's the process that's different.
You'll know where to find me, should you have the need.

The Duchess is unwilling to elaborate on the origins of her affliction, but seems to more readily embrace its effects more than others. While in human form she is a peerless fencer, her real power comes when her body falters and she transforms into a great beast, recklessly charging headlong into her enemies, driven by insatiable hunger. She seems unfazed by this transformation, and in fact gains comfort from it, leading to the terrible implication that the Duchess may no longer consider her human body her true form.

The Duchess' black blade is an heirloom weapon of great heft and masterful construction; with it, she cleaves a swathe through her enemies, hewing limbs and severing arteries. Her tattered dress, though aged and ostensibly impractical, is padded and reinforced with heavy iron plates. It is a testament to her enormous strength that she is capable of wielding such equipment with graceful ease.

The Duchess' lavish heritage is self-evident in her time at camp, where she demands the finest comforts one could manage. She is not entirely without use, however, as her unique affliction affords herself a certain value in replenishing dwindling stock of valuable Blood.
"An empty court playing host to a bloody coronation."
"A peerless swordswoman honed by years of practice."
"Please accept this gift, along with my apologies..."

A monster exiled from her pack, seeking an army to usurp a hostile queen. Have we fallen on such desperate times that we'd consider throwing our lot in with the very creatures we've sought out to destroy?
Your sword arm is strong, and you've got good sense.
Should you die, I would briefly mourn you before eating your corpse. High praise, you know!
Your grace matches my own, in some ways.
As a girl, such bruises and bumps were common fare from my instructors.
Please, you're not nearly as appetizing as you think.
Your discomfort is noted, dear. Now bite on this while we set that bone.
Relax. I'm here.
Now, if I were to die, that'd be cause for concern.
I wouldn't think too hard about how it works. I'm just hungry a lot.
Take of me what you need.
Never say I've not sacrificed for this cause.
Don't worry. I'll take my payment soon enough.
A lady needs her beauty rest.
Goosedown pillow and fine sheets fit for royalty.
Of course I made room for it. What do I need with torches?
I'm on a diet.
No thank you dear, I'm on a cleanse.
I'm keeping an eye on my figure.
A proper lady knows enough to keep them wanting.
Hunger and thirst are similar enough. It's the process that's different.
You'll know where to find me, should you have the need.

The Duchess is unwilling to elaborate on the origins of her affliction, but seems to more readily embrace its effects more than others. While in human form she is a peerless fencer, her real power comes when her body falters and she transforms into a great beast, recklessly charging headlong into her enemies, driven by insatiable hunger. She seems unfazed by this transformation, and in fact gains comfort from it, leading to the terrible implication that the Duchess may no longer consider her human body her true form.

The Duchess' black blade is an heirloom weapon of great heft and masterful construction; with it, she cleaves a swathe through her enemies, hewing limbs and severing arteries. Her tattered dress, though aged and ostensibly impractical, is padded and reinforced with heavy iron plates. It is a testament to her enormous strength that she is capable of wielding such equipment with graceful ease.

The Duchess' lavish heritage is self-evident in her time at camp, where she demands the finest comforts one could manage. She is not entirely without use, however, as her unique affliction affords herself a certain value in replenishing dwindling stock of valuable Blood.
"A peerless swordswoman honed by years of practice."
"Please accept this gift, along with my apologies..."
"An empty court playing host to a bloody coronation."

A monster exiled from her pack, seeking an army to usurp a hostile queen. Have we fallen on such desperate times that we'd consider throwing our lot in with the very creatures we've sought out to destroy?
Your sword arm is strong, and you've got good sense.

You'll know where to find me, should you have the need.

The Duchess is unwilling to elaborate on the origins of her affliction, but seems to more readily embrace its effects more than others. While in human form she is a peerless fencer, her real power comes when her body falters and she transforms into a great beast, recklessly charging headlong into her enemies, driven by insatiable hunger. She seems unfazed by this transformation, and in fact gains comfort from it, leading to the terrible implication that the Duchess may no longer consider her human body her true form.

The Duchess' black blade is an heirloom weapon of great heft and masterful construction; with it, she cleaves a swathe through her enemies, hewing limbs and severing arteries. Her tattered dress, though aged and ostensibly impractical, is padded and reinforced with heavy iron plates. It is a testament to her enormous strength that she is capable of wielding such equipment with graceful ease.

The Duchess' lavish heritage is self-evident in her time at camp, where she demands the finest comforts one could manage. She is not entirely without use, however, as her unique affliction affords herself a certain value in replenishing dwindling stock of valuable Blood.
"A peerless swordswoman honed by years of practice."
"Please accept this gift, along with my apologies..."
"An empty court playing host to a bloody coronation."

Her tattered dress, though aged and ostensibly impractical, is padded and reinforced with heavy iron plates. It is a testament to her enormous strength that she is capable of wielding such equipment with graceful ease.

The Duchess' lavish heritage is self-evident in her time at camp, where she demands the finest comforts one could manage. She is not entirely without use, however, as her unique affliction affords herself a certain value in replenishing dwindling stock of valuable Blood.
"A peerless swordswoman honed by years of practice."
"Please accept this gift, along with my apologies..."
"An empty court playing host to a bloody coronation."

You'll know where to find me, should you have the need.

The Duchess is unwilling to elaborate on the origins of her affliction, but seems to more readily embrace its effects more than others. While in human form she is a peerless fencer, her real power comes when her body falters and she transforms into a great beast, recklessly charging headlong into her enemies, driven by insatiable hunger. She seems unfazed by this transformation, and in fact gains comfort from it, leading to the terrible implication that the Duchess may no longer consider her human body her true form.

The Duchess' black blade is an heirloom weapon of great heft and masterful construction; with it, she cleaves a swathe through her enemies, hewing limbs and severing arteries. Her tattered dress, though aged and ostensibly impractical, is padded and reinforced with heavy iron plates. It is a testament to her enormous strength that she is capable of wielding such equipment with graceful ease.

The Duchess' lavish heritage is self-evident in her time at camp, where she demands the finest comforts one could manage. She is not entirely without use, however, as her unique affliction affords herself a certain value in replenishing dwindling stock of valuable Blood.
"A peerless swordswoman honed by years of practice."
"Please accept this gift, along with my apologies..."
"An empty court playing host to a bloody coronation."

I'm keeping an eye on my figure.
A proper lady knows enough to keep them wanting.
Hunger and thirst are similar enough. It's the process that's different.
You'll know where to find me, should you have the need.

The Duchess is unwilling to elaborate on the origins of her affliction, but seems to more readily embrace its effects more than others. While in human form she is a peerless fencer, her real power comes when her body falters and she transforms into a great beast, recklessly charging headlong into her enemies, driven by insatiable hunger. She seems unfazed by this transformation, and in fact gains comfort from it, leading to the terrible implication that the Duchess may no longer consider her human body her true form.

The Duchess' black blade is an heirloom weapon of great heft and masterful construction; with it, she cleaves a swathe through her enemies, hewing limbs and severing arteries. Her tattered dress, though aged and ostensibly impractical, is padded and reinforced with heavy iron plates. It is a testament to her enormous strength that she is capable of wielding such equipment with graceful ease.

The Duchess' lavish heritage is self-evident in her time at camp, where she demands the finest comforts one could manage. She is not entirely without use, however, as her unique affliction affords herself a certain value in replenishing dwindling stock of valuable Blood.
"A peerless swordswoman honed by years of practice."
"Please accept this gift, along with my apologies..."
"An empty court playing host to a bloody coronation."

Butchery, in every sense of the word!
Ooh, lunch.
Monsters? Hmph. Meals.

Swordswoman or sous chef?

Aaah, fresh meat.
Misplaced limbs are not my fault.

I feel... famished.
So... hungry...
You're all looking a bit like swollen sausages right about now.
I smell... meat.

This feels... wrong.

Hush. Noise ahead.

Good. Let's continue.

Ahh, disappointing.

Aaah, a waste of good blood.

如果你死了，我就吃掉你。
啊哈，新鲜的肉。
四肢错位可不是我的错。
来吧，你不会因为这么小的伤而让你慢下来吧？

我觉得……快饿死了。
如此……饥饿……
你们现在看起来有点像填满的香肠。

这种感觉……不对劲。

安静。前方有噪音。

别用这种卖弄风情的游戏来嘲弄我们。
那个时候我没有爱上它，现在我也不会爱上它。
哦，我是不是正中要害了？
这种愤怒有种熟悉的感觉。
你总是那么容易被激怒。
之前的只是一场游戏。而现在这次是来真的了。这次我也会赢的。
再坚持下去的话，我就把它当项链戴着。
当这一切结束过后，你的头将装饰我的宝座。
天哪，你变胖了。
我还没决定是吃了你还是让你腐烂后作为一个例子。
人总是可以更上一层楼的。
你已经尽可能的高尚了，但我已经完美无缺了。
钻石不是由柔软的岩石制成的。
是的，是的。只是你先别急。
敢摘下我的头盔，我就摘下你的脸皮。
你治不了这个的。但你可以试试减小毒性。
看起来就像是在浪费。一点点的放血疗法就能治好一切。
那个长得漂亮，戴着帽子的人。她还有鼻烟吗？
你远不如那个戴着鸟嘴面具的人温柔。
嗯，温暖舒适，但是需要干活。
陌生的时代造就了陌生的伙伴。
真是个愚……愉快的地方。
这里并不是家，但目前为止还可以。
你面临着一项艰巨的任务。你需要盟友。你需要我。
我需要一支军队，你需要士兵。我们做个交易吧。
庭院和它的怪物可不会等待。
如果你想摆脱诅咒，就必须采取行动。
我们濒临崩溃。不要再耽搁了。
外面很平静。几乎是一种安慰。很奇怪。
嗯，今天我有点饿。
我认为带着你出去吃晚饭会很没意思了。
今天有这么多潜在的食物……
我想要翻找一下……我想要……吃的。
地狱般的恐惧与内心的空虚相比是微不足道的。
咿呢咪呢唛呢哞，抓住一个农民的脚趾……
啊哈哈哈！别再逃了，你只会力竭而亡的！
我一直都知道这事会发生的。什么样的怪物会相信一个人？
我早料到了。我相信你不会接受的。
我只是为了回报一个人类的话。
我以前经历过一次死亡。我仍然无动于衷。
别指望我的死能把你从束缚中解放出来。
终于有机会见到我的创造者了。
我可能会倒下。但这不会是结束。
这将是一个崇高的结局，但对于……
现在你知道地狱的景观了。
第一关还不错。其余的……
这下面也有饥饿之物。我能感觉的到……
这里和地下之物有血缘关系。而且和在它上面东西的也有，现在……
不知怎的……我再也不觉得其他任何事物是可怕的了。
……我好像失去了食欲。哼……
下面潜伏之物才是对我们所有人的威胁。庭院可以先等等了。
如果不是那么尴尬的话，那这就很讽刺了！
放开我，马上！
我才是在这附近进食的人！
我决定让鱼人们成为更好的盟友。
一首魅惑人心的歌……可能还……奏效了……？
在情场和战场上可以不择手段。但这个……两者皆有。
不起，亲爱的，但是它们比你们人更多。
我想你终究唤回了我的忠诚。
哦，真难受！我的脑袋被，呃，贝壳扰乱了？
我认为数量也是质量的一种。
我们分手了。鸡毛蒜皮的事，我不想谈。
我的罪过之重……！
不！我不是你们中的一员！
我凌驾与此之上！
我不能——不会——被阻止的！

你的剑挥舞的很强壮，而且你很有判断力。
如果你死了，我会在吃你的尸体之前先哀悼你。你知道的，我很欣赏你！
在某些方面，你的优雅与我的相般配。
作为一个女孩，这样的瘀伤和颠簸是我的导师习以为常的。
拜托，你不像你想象的那么令人胃口大开。
我注意到了你的不适，亲爱的。现在我们把骨头复位的时候咬住这个。
放轻松。我在这里。
现在，如果我死了，那就值得担心了。
我不会太在意它是怎么起效的。我只是饿了很多。
把你需要的东西拿走。
千万不要说我没有为这个事业做出牺牲。
别担心。我很快就索取我的回报。
一位女士需要睡她的美容觉。
鹅绒枕头和适合皇室的精致床单。
我当然为它腾出了空间。我需要火把干什么？
我在节食。
不，谢谢你，亲爱的，我正在斋戒。
我在留意我的身材。
一位真正的女士知道的很多足以让他们保持欲望的方法。
饥饿和饥渴渴是非常相似的。只是过程不同而已。
如果你有需要的话，你会知道去哪里找我的。
公爵夫人不愿意详细说明她的痛苦的来源，但她似乎比其他人更容易接受其影响。在人类形态时，她是一个无与伦比的剑士，当她的身体颤抖着变成一头巨大野兽的时候，在永不满足的饥饿驱使下，肆无忌惮地冲向敌人时，她的真正力量才会显现出来。她似乎对这中变身毫不担心，事实上她从中得到了安慰，这导致了可怕的影响，公爵夫人可能不再认为她的人类形态是她的真实形态。
公爵夫人的漆黑巨刃是一件祖传的武器，它有着巨大的重量和精美的构造；她用它在敌人身上劈开一条血痕，砍断四肢和动脉。她那件破烂的衣服虽然很旧了，而且表面上华而不实，但却用厚铁板加以填充和加固。她能优雅自如地挥舞这些装备，这证明了她有巨大的力量。
公爵夫人在营地的传统方式有多奢华是不言而喻的，在那里她需要尽可能最好的舒适。然而，她并非完全没有用处，因为她独特的痛苦使她自己在补充日益减少的宝贵血液储备方面具有一定的价值。

Your shows were always so gauche.
You rely too much on the lash, Baron.

Putrid slavedriver. I'll get my due.
Get back here you little bug. I'll squash you flat!
You think you can run from me?
I will carve a swath through a thousand of your sycophants!
You can't hide. I'll sniff you out.
The bully flees when the bullied can fight back.

He's getting desperate.
Keep running. You'll die tired.
I'm going to find you, and when I do...

I am nothing like him!
You bloated pig, you know nothing of hunger.

We are nothing alike!
She falters!
Winded already?
Royalty has made you soft.
I'll not incubate your hellspawn!
Funny, never pegged you as the motherly type.
Your children will be just as putrid as you, I'm sure.
The pus-filled sac doesn't fall far from the bloody, leaking tree.
Don't mock us with this coquettish game.
I didn't fall for it then, I won't fall for it now.
Oh, did I strike a nerve?
There's that familiar anger.
You were always so easy to provoke.

Stick it out any longer and I'll wear it like a necklace.
When this is over, your head will decorate my throne.
By God you've gotten fat.
I haven't decided whether to eat you or let you rot as an example.
One could always improve on perfection.
Noble of you to try, but I'm already flawless.

Yes, yes. Just get with the prodding already.
Remove my helmet and I'll remove your face.

Seems like a waste. A little bloodletting will cure anything.

What a du-... delightful place.
It's not home, but it'll do for now.

If you are to be freed of the Curse, there must be action.

Mm, feeling peckish today.

So many potential meals about today...
I would delve... I would... EAT.
The horror below is nothing compared to the emptiness within.
Eenie meenie minie moe, catch a peasant by the toe...
Ahahaha! Don't run, you'll only die tired!

It would be a noble end, but for...
And now you know the shape of what is below.

... I seemed to have lost my appetite. Hm...
What lurks below is a threat to us all. The Court can wait.
This would be ironic if it weren't so embarrassing!
Free me, immediately!
I'm the one doing the eating around here!
I've decided the fishmen make better allies.
An alluring song... could be... useful...?
All's fair in love and war. And this... is a little of both.
Sorry dear, but there are more of them than there are of you.
I guess you earned my loyalty after all.
Oh, the misery! My mind was clouded by, er, seashells?
I suppose quality has a quantity all its own.

A monster exiled from her pack, seeking an army to usurp a hostile queen. Have we fallen on such desperate times that we'd consider throwing our lot in with the very creatures we've sought out to destroy?
Your sword arm is strong, and you've got good sense.
Should you die, I would briefly mourn you before eating your corpse. High praise, you know!
Your grace matches my own, in some ways.

Please, you're not nearly as appetizing as you think.
Your discomfort is noted, dear. Now bite on this while we set that bone.
Relax. I'm here.
Now, if I were to die, that'd be cause for concern.
I wouldn't think too hard about how it works. I'm just hungry a lot.
Take of me what you need.
Never say I've not sacrificed for this cause.
Don't worry. I'll take my payment soon enough.
A lady needs her beauty rest.
Goosedown pillow and fine sheets fit for royalty.
Of course I made room for it. What do I need with torches?
I'm on a diet.
No thank you dear, I'm on a cleanse.
I'm keeping an eye on my figure.
A proper lady knows enough to keep them wanting.
Hunger and thirst are similar enough. It's the process that's different.
You'll know where to find me, should you have the need.

The Duchess is unwilling to elaborate on the origins of her affliction, but seems to more readily embrace its effects more than others. While in human form she is a peerless fencer, her real power comes when her body falters and she transforms into a great beast, recklessly charging headlong into her enemies, driven by insatiable hunger. She seems unfazed by this transformation, and in fact gains comfort from it, leading to the terrible implication that the Duchess may no longer consider her human body her true form.

The Duchess' black blade is an heirloom weapon of great heft and masterful construction; with it, she cleaves a swathe through her enemies, hewing limbs and severing arteries. Her tattered dress, though aged and ostensibly impractical, is padded and reinforced with heavy iron plates. It is a testament to her enormous strength that she is capable of wielding such equipment with graceful ease.

The Duchess' lavish heritage is self-evident in her time at camp, where she demands the finest comforts one could manage. She is not entirely without use, however, as her unique affliction affords herself a certain value in replenishing dwindling stock of valuable Blood.

A monster exiled from her pack, seeking an army to usurp a hostile queen. Have we fallen on such desperate times that we'd consider throwing our lot in with the very creatures we've sought out to destroy?

The Duchess is unwilling to elaborate on the origins of her affliction, but seems to more readily embrace its effects more than others. While in human form she is a peerless fencer, her real power comes when her body falters and she transforms into a great beast, recklessly charging headlong into her enemies, driven by insatiable hunger. She seems unfazed by this transformation, and in fact gains comfort from it, leading to the terrible implication that the Duchess may no longer consider her human body her true form.

The Duchess' black blade is an heirloom weapon of great heft and masterful construction; with it, she cleaves a swathe through her enemies, hewing limbs and severing arteries. Her tattered dress, though aged and ostensibly impractical, is padded and reinforced with heavy iron plates. It is a testament to her enormous strength that she is capable of wielding such equipment with graceful ease.

The Duchess' lavish heritage is self-evident in her time at camp, where she demands the finest comforts one could manage. She is not entirely without use, however, as her unique affliction affords herself a certain value in replenishing dwindling stock of valuable Blood.
"A peerless swordswoman honed by years of practice."
"Please accept this gift, along with my apologies..."
"An empty court playing host to a bloody coronation."
